AC95B72064804C08B5046EDC2F177AC2.description: Apply criteria to judge the quality of their viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing.

C4B8AA6195A14FB6BA3634E8B0EF690D.description: Develop criteria, with teacher support, for creating and assessing viewing, listening, speaking, reading, writing, and other representing experiences.

F1BDD27448B44DE3B341676F3BD16388.description: Ask self “Am I understanding?” and employ specific “fix-up” strategies (e.g., slow down; re-view, reread, listen again; get help) when something does not make sense.

6E06C1ADBB1A47F59E29FF555F967733.description: Consider “What is important to know?” and “How can I remember this?”

E707281206094BD48C589186CCF37265.description: Reflect, with guidance, on own strategies (“What do I do well? How could I be better?”) and consider how to improve (“What must I do to make this better?”).

6C13144701A948AE894207D2912C4654.description: Reflect, with guidance, on viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing by explaining what is effective or what works in a text.

1B77F3C5E72944C6BA1C5924A8B6A158.description: Set personal goals to view, listen, read, speak, write, and use other forms of representing more effectively and discuss a plan for achieving them.

6484D7D2CDE0401C8088A631E2EF4B4F.description: Apply criteria to judge the quality of their viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing.

1A1660BFDAC74257B8D9B87FF99C1DFD.description: Develop criteria, with teacher support, for creating and assessing viewing, listening, speaking, reading, writing, and other representing experiences.

4E1D751497334AD0866039E15D6F0C35.description: Ask self “Am I understanding?” and employ specific “fix-up” strategies (e.g., slow down; re-view, reread, listen again; get help) when something does not make sense.

3582277C8A354810B7910032C0FF8954.description: Consider “What is important to know?” and “How can I remember this?”

1B247F42882142E7BE0240EE3C6F1402.description: Reflect, with guidance, on own strategies (“What do I do well? How could I be better?”) and consider how to improve (“What must I do to make this better?”).

6636B5557F954D09A8D14214960CA77F.description: Reflect, with guidance, on viewing, listening, reading, representing, speaking, and writing by explaining what is effective or what works in a text.

28B11C714761484190C798867B9D1AB3.description: Reflect on and assess their viewing, listening, reading, speaking, writing, and other representing experiences and the selected strategies they have used (e.g., using class-generated criteria).

49A5D6163BF54EC080D8A94A57034754.description: Assess and Reflect (AR). Students will develop their abilities to assess and reflect on their own language skills, discuss the skills of effective viewers, listeners, readers, representers, speakers, and writers, and set goals for future improvement.

85DE4713303445FD839EABCF40AAD173.description: Extend, rework, and polish pieces of writing for an audience in and beyond the classroom.

6911C07018904BD2BFE3BFF42C5F63ED.description: Write personal letters, thank-you notes, invitations, and logs.

C823D3EEC7534229ACCB5D87D1222E70.description: Begin to use excitement, humour, suspense, and other creative devices.

2C2A7F20CEE6495487046057A8D9DC0C.description: Write descriptions that use concrete sensory details

DA49F4CB679F404F9C548F57A47A5CF8.description: Create characters and events from outside students’ personal environment.

E4DD2C0B3C8C4D6E9F0C813112C3D1C9.description: Write narratives that provide a context within which an action takes place and includes characters and their traits, setting, and problem and solution in students’ stories.

C68396DD27F645A4A0CC8AB821192F5C.description: Write compositions (e.g., three-paragraph reports) that describe and explain familiar objects, events, and experiences.

92256862BE6E4F91B2E6A03A36DA3E41.description: Understand and apply the suitable pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when writing

28D1C92F6A994933A63F5D9F390FDDFD.description: Select and use appropriate strategies (before, during, and after) to communicate meaning when writing.

975AEBB550A64962B8B3709F3FD9E0CF.description: Work through the stages of a writing process (e.g., pre-writing, drafting, revising selected draft material, sharing) and begin to write for extended periods of time.

EE55FA68995042CCB1D458C389A3ED2A.description: Write to communicate ideas, information, and experiences pertaining to a topic by creating easy-to-follow writing (including a short report, a procedure, a letter, a story, a short script, and a poem) with a clear purpose, correct paragraph structure, and interesting detail.

4790BAE7834C40A288E5C7316FE1F8E7.description: Plan and present, with clear diction, pitch, tempo, and tone, dramatic interpretations of experiences, stories, poems, or plays.

A5EF24005BAA45CABBE448268995A429.description: Read prose, scripts, and poetry including First Nations and Métis texts aloud with fluency, expression, and appropriate pace, using intonation and vocal patterns to emphasize important ideas and passages of the text being read.

D069FC8620264735854721509E98D17B.description: Retell a narrative including an oral story from a First Nations and Métis perspective.

A9EBE2C7378E4B90B5028E66878C1490.description: Make narrative presentations, providing a context for an incident and insight into why the selected incident is memorable, and include well-chosen details to develop character, setting, and plot.

14F178BD67954673A9E58C0DE845AFB3.description: Deliver brief recitations and oral presentations (including reporting to class) about familiar experiences or interests, organized and focused on a central idea.

02C16556618C49BFA3DC1DEF13A51001.description: Provide a beginning, a middle, and an end and include concrete details that develop a central idea and link words to organize and present their ideas.

15CBCB7F72F64566B277DCDF476AF125.description: Organize and present ideas chronologically or around major points of information.

64CDD4D77B6D4E75825D7FC67F933FA4.description: Understand and apply the suitable pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when speaking.

330199CFCA2D470B8250DD6376916163.description: Select and use appropriate strategies (before, during, and after) to communicate meaning when speaking.

4F22CDC3A9B54ACA8C3AFEFF2804B939.description: Use oral language to clarify and extend personal understanding, interact courteously with others (e.g., share ideas and opinions, complete tasks, discuss concerns or problems), and sustain conversations by extending others’ contributions

18CCB54DF57A4859866F29FC9F997D75.description: Speak to present ideas and information appropriately in informal (e.g., interacting appropriately with others to share ideas and opinions, complete tasks, and discuss concerns or problems) and some formal situations (e.g., giving oral explanations, delivering short, simple reports, demonstrating and describing basic procedures) for different audiences and purposes.

C92C945C154F4EF5B05253B342BDEF43.description: Experiment with a variety of resources (e.g., human, print, multimedia) to communicate a clear and complete message appropriate to purpose

0FF3CC8D33D246949833169C0D7D1671.description: Use visual aids to enhance spoken and written products (e.g., props, charts, sound, illustrations, or movement to accompany a story) and to clarify and enhance oral presentations.

DD16769B59574820853E54EA49E164A4.description: Depict main ideas in a new form (e.g., designing a safety poster or three-dimensional safety object in response to a multimedia presentation or story).

90CF1A986DD74EB69C7B88975342B826.description: Understand and apply the suitable pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other cues and conventions to construct and communicate meaning when using other forms of representing.

81E73B1725964C558E7F50EEB8AA5014.description: Select and use appropriate strategies (before, during, and after) to communicate meaning when using other forms of representing.

01CDBAB425FA4BC8808B3637BC639A31.description: Demonstrate understanding of the topic, problem, question, or issue in a variety of ways (e.g., dance pieces, visual representations, drama in context, diagram, demonstration, chart).

0A88A64297974E02B5D942744C863098.description: Communicate ideas and information pertaining to topics, problems, questions, or issues by creating easy-tofollow representations with a clear purpose.

1087A2904AA34E67B3E43818FDF04B8C.description: Use inquiry to explore a question, topic, problem, or issue that students, individually or as a group, want to know more about or want to resolve/solve:  Record and share personal knowledge and understanding of a topic, Answer inquiry questions using a variety of sources such as children’s magazines, folktales, the environment, and online resources, Review information and ideas to determine their usefulness to inquiry or research needs, Determine main ideas that will inform inquiry questions, Organize and explain understandings, ideas, and information using a variety of strategies such as clustering, categorizing, and sequencing, Record understanding, ideas, and facts using a variety of strategies such as webbing and charting, and list the sources, Determine whether ideas and information collected is sufficient or adequate for established purpose, Share and report what was learned in an easy-to-follow visual, oral, and written format, Assess inquiry or research experiences and skills and Use the language of inquiry (e.g., “We learned ….”).

07EA15F5BDAF4280B346D41C150C35A8.description: Create a variety of narratives and poems.

AB0FD47B41974ACBB1AC90A80D723333.description: Communicate ideas, findings, and information pertaining to topics, problems, questions, or issues by creating easy-to-follow visual, oral, and written formats with a clear purpose (e.g., short report, explanation of a procedure).

AAAF8FE161AD4958B1C627E85E6DB4B8.description: Create spoken, written, and other representations that include: a main idea(s) with supporting details, explanations, and examples, a beginning that introduces the topic, a middle that is sequenced and connected to the topic, and an ending and appropriate use of language and conventions including conventional print.

A1B1158CAFF34336A70E5CDF9F0DA357.description: Communicate thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly and, when appropriate, artistically.

0F825E9BA6B545F18082701680F7E4DD.description: Use words, symbols, and other forms, including appropriate technology, to express understanding of topics, themes, and issues and make connections to learning in other areas of study

B9437C5C6DB341E0838890E22776880B.description: Compose and create a range of visual, multimedia, oral, and written texts that explore: identity (e.g., Spreading My Wings), community (e.g., Helping Others) and social responsibility (e.g., Communities Around the World) and make connections across areas of study.

584BE6DBD6784C0B8906907B88DA1DD6.description: Compose and Create (CC). Students will develop their abilities to speak, write, and use other forms of representation to explore and present thoughts, feelings, and experiences in a variety of forms for a variety of purposes and audiences.

7224BAAF0FC24A9784194C92B9AADE6F.description: Monitor for meaning and reread when meaning is not clear; read and reread just-right texts to increase fluency (80-110 wcpm orally; 120-170 silently) and comprehension.

73E9DB0607CA4904BFE46C65664E46D6.description: Interpret poetry and infer main ideas, lessons, or morals in a variety of prose selections including First Nations and Métis texts.

25A883C133554F8C81C21BD10A958153.description: Comprehend the basic plots of traditional tales (including First Nations and Métis narratives), fairy tales, and fables from around the world, identify the common elements (e.g., characters, setting, problem/solution), and note and talk about author’s content and craft

6B4B1164A4B540BF9661FC118AADC911.description: Follow simple written multi-step instructions (e.g., how to assemble a product or play a board game) and functional and instructional messages in the environment (e.g., instructions, menus, invitations, announcements).

1E75E194813E44E593B52903322C1EC7.description: Identify the main idea and supporting details in informational text and extract appropriate and significant information.

E6D036D2A9EE40B1AEAB5771191AECB1.description: Ask questions and support answers by connecting prior knowledge with literal information found in, and inferred from, texts including First Nations and Métis resources.

E9E4932A209846218C70E6BC1114AB2D.description: Understand and apply the suitable pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other cues and conventions to construct and confirm meaning when reading.

86BA75DDB3774ADDA8B46A78B225761D.description: Select and use appropriate strategies (before, during, and after) to construct and confirm meaning when reading.

96164A62874B41D798B32B96F62E351F.description: Read orally and silently (e.g., 10 to 15 minutes) for enjoyment and information and move comfortably from oral to silent reading.

B03BD7499E08400B86B1B3E78B8DF872.description: Read fluently and demonstrate comprehension of grade-appropriate fiction, script, poetry, and nonfiction from various cultures (including First Nations and Métis) and countries (including Canada) and explain reactions and connections to texts read.

35DDA654A1674475B53FA123F95ED599.description: Listen attentively and courteously to each other in discussions and to guest speakers; show respect for the ideas, language, and communication styles of others; and give sensitive and thoughtful responses.

86B878372B6146279F19B6453009872B.description: Identify simple poetic effects in oral language (e.g., rhymes, repeated sounds, instances of onomatopoeia and alliteration).

8713D6AF9B7148E9B8D4681DF5F5030D.description: Retell, paraphrase, and explain what a speaker said (including Elders, Knowledge Keepers, and community members).

E27DCC9277894F89A1F3140FCC1BC8C7.description: Identify and explain what peers said about a particular text or subject.

D0E0ACFF9998435CB57C1199768C4664.description: Distinguish between speaker’s opinions and verifiable fact.

DDF54F89EEFB428991A40965C5E0967E.description: Understand and apply the suitable pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other cues and conventions to construct and confirm meaning when listening.

1411C13912F94253BBF1A9B212B22514.description: Select and use appropriate strategies (before, during, and after) to construct and confirm meaning when listening.

A1B94B9C4BF8480D86101325F262E88F.description: Listen to a short presentation and make some notes

E5D10D09304F47869E8EBACD95AF700D.description: Listen to and understand information, identify main ideas and supporting details, compare different ideas and points of view, and explain connections made between texts heard.

3B9885A17B2D4A658559EF52E7CCCB00.description: Identify and discuss the key visual features such as colour, line, and size of an illustrator’s style and how they relate to print text and add to or supplement words.

40BD0FC2FACA4ADF9012034D40948201.description: Compare a variety of visual representations of the same story or tale (including contemporary and traditional First Nations and Métis stories and art) and compare ideas and points of view expressed in various media.

ECA3A80B3EB34AF3AD08796FE3235140.description: View and identify purpose for visual features used.

BAE6274E9AC24B1AA6364C15CCC392AB.description: Describe perspectives or messages promoted by particular visual depictions in a film/video/DVD or magazine article.

96043E9B070A468A9E15D091AD7A777A.description: Identify design, layout, and other features (e.g., colour, bold typeface, and sound effects) that help to understand gradeappropriate visual and multimedia texts (including First Nations and Métis resources)

02893B977605474E91C9A64DC6DA81BB.description: Record facts and ideas from grade-appropriate visual and multimedia texts including DVD, television program, magazine, and reference resources.

BA10B9AC0B544773B832B7D0CC1E2FBC.description: Understand and apply the suitable pragmatic, textual, syntactical, semantic/lexical/morphological, graphophonic, and other cues and conventions to construct and confirm meaning when viewing.

104AF34F6178466CBA9249EED72A404E.description: Select and use appropriate strategies (before, during, and after) to construct and confirm meaning when viewing.

1EBDD9A7C958462284C21F6E9F745320.description: Determine main ideas in visual and multimedia texts including safe websites designed for children (including First Nations and Métis resources).

23B2128DB6D34551A06EBD45C5568543.description: View and respond to grade-appropriate visual and multimedia texts (including videos, cartoons, illustrations, diagrams, charts, maps, and posters) explaining reactions and connections as well as visual features that convey humour, emotion, and mood.

849CF9F4EDF347A9ABDB7243B9C437DB.description: Recognize the range of cultures, human behaviours, experiences, emotions, and ideas conveyed through literary texts including First Nations and Métis texts.

6F3DD5BA78CC4396B373B069E45233ED.description: Compare portrayals of individuals or situations in various texts to personal experiences.

A238CA7096D24A1094F47094273FE459.description: Describe similarities between experiences and traditions encountered in daily life and those portrayed in various texts including First Nations and Métis texts.

4295522E4A2D422987C7A2E8990417E7.description: View, listen to, read, and respond to a variety of texts that reflect the issues related to identity, community, and social responsibility and connect to personal experiences, other texts, and other areas of study.

58CE9E8A5CD34473874882894FF00501.description: Comprehend and respond to a variety of grade-level texts (including contemporary and traditional visual, oral, written, and multimedia) that address: identity (e.g., Spreading My Wings), community (e.g., Hand in Hand) and social responsibility (e.g., All Together) and make comparison with personal experiences.

0C56FD38B51D43FA81D1A49E3CD4B312.description: Comprehend and Respond (CR). Students will develop their abilities to view, listen to, read, comprehend, and respond to a variety of contemporary and traditional grade-level-appropriate texts in a variety of forms (oral, print, and other media) from First Nations, Métis, and other cultures for a variety of purposes including for learning, interest, and enjoyment.
